revised_title: Electrophoretic Analysis of Phylogeny and Evolutionary Rates in Partula Snails
tldr: This study examines the phylogeny and evolutionary rates of the Partula snails from the Society Islands using electrophoretic analysis of allozymes. The results suggest that the radiation of Partula in the Society Islands can be explained by a single colonization of each island. The average rate of allozymic divergence is estimated to be 0.126 per million years, with a threefold variation in rates within Partula. The findings challenge the idea that geographical isolation and multiple colonizations play significant roles in the radiation of other animals in archipelagos.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
